description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 2.5 Primary School Completion All girls and boys are motivated to stay in school and complete their primary education., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Protection â€“ General, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Human Rights Institutions, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 2 Keep Children LearningImproved education quality and learning outcomes using an equitable and inclusive approach with a focus on girls' education

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.5 Primary School Completion All girls and boys are motivated to stay in school and complete their primaryeducation.
Number and % of primary schools in 75 target districts where VAC is regularly tracked and reported
Number and % of children in target districts brought back to school
Number and % of schools in target districts equipped with facilities to promote inclusive education
Completion rate for boys and girls in 75 target districts

actual.value: 2015:Completion rates improved for boys and girls from 52% (boys 55%, girls 48%) female) in 2009/10 to 72% (B 72.%, G 72%).
